rComments: RYAN IS AMAZING! Such a good teacher! Makes learning difficult concepts super fun and easy. Really cares about students and is very responsive to input. Fairly easy A, interesting subject...Also, Ryan is REALLY REALLY HOT and has an easy going, goofy personality! Great class, great professor. Never missed class, it was so worth it!

Ryan is everything a good professor should be and a little bit more: passionate about his subject, went above and beyond to help students out and even got to know all of us on a first-name basis, and on top of that, he's very attractive. Interesting intro course, extremely easy. I definitely recommend taking Ryan's class. He's great!

Ryan is wonderful. His class is engaging, interesting, and fun. I am definitely not an astronomy major, and I thoroughly enjoyed his class. He is very available for help and is willing to do anything to get students to understand. There is a lot of group work in section, but its bearable.  Overall, Ryan is a great teacher and person.
Ryan is one of the best professors I have had at UCSC. He is quirky and keeps the class interesting and fun at the same time while still delivering information. You will not regret taking this class.

He is the BEST!!!!!!! I love his class SOOOO much!.  I am a Bio Major and after this class I was sooo tempted to change majors. This class blew my mind. Plus he is HOOOOOOOT! I urge anyone to take the class

Super engaging professor, Ryan makes hilarious attempts to simulate rotation and orbits using a chair, his body and his hands, spinning around while explaining, in his highly amusing speech pattern, what he's doing.  I'm now healthily interested in astronomy and can talk about it with people in fun, interesting ways.  Great class.
He's still pretty new at teaching a large class, but I think that once he figures out the dynamic of it, he'll be an awesome teacher. Very handsome and sweet as well. Too bad he's married.

Ryan is hilarious and one of the best professors I've had. He's really invested in the class and wants everyone to do well. If you do what he asks you the class is really easy, for science people and non-science people alike. There is math involved but if you go to lecture and section it will be easy to understand. Oh, and he's gorgeous.

AWESOME PROFESSOR. I hate science and was excited to attend his lectures. His analogies for things are hilarious, and his awkwardness is adorable. You will not regret signing up for this class! (Especially if you're a girl)

Ryan. Best teacher I've had at UCSC. Hands down. He's hilarious, helpful, and just an overall amazing teacher. It's definitely worth taking class solely to have him as a teacher. It's super easy too if you actually do what he asks you to do!
Best class ever! Ryan was awesome.. and amazing. Interesting class. And if you at all tried, it wasn't that difficult (And this is coming from a non-math person).

Ryan is absolutely amazing! He's so passionate about the subject and will try to clarify anything you don't understand. He's so funny with all his jokes like "yourmomium" being a dense element. TAKE THIS CLASS! You definitely won't regret it.

Ryan is the coolest teacher I've ever had. It's very obvious that he loves the subject, and he's very passionate about sharing his knowledge with us. He's super personable and cracks some pretty good jokes, even asking us to throw up a "gang" sign if we ever saw him around campus. He's wonderful!

Ryan is by far my favorite teacher at UCSC.  I took the class only to satisfy my math requirement, but it ended up being one of the best classes I've taken here.  You'll definitely need to do the reading, but it's not too hard.  Just take the mini quizzes and bring your clicker to class. Easy A.

He loves his job and it shows.  Really passionate about astronomy and makes it interesting.  I actually looked forward to his lectures.  Easy A if you put in the time to do homework and attend sections.  One of my favorite teachers at UCSC.

An energenic, enthuastic, entertaining guy. He really cares about teaching and loves what he does. Definitely the funnest class I've ever been in and I normally HATE math and science. Definitely take this class if you can.

He was a lot of fun. Everyday he gets the whole class laughing. It was easy as long as you did the work and came to lecture. He's definitely passionate which made the class a lot of fun. He's pretty young and super chill. The only thing I didn't like was the section.

He has a great sense of humor and I look forward to going to his class! The material is pretty easy to grasp just as long as you show up for lectures, iClicker, no midterm, quiz every other week, mandatory section attendance. Class is not curved so this is not a class to slack off in but it's really fun (just make sure you get the good TA..)

So funny, so helpful, so cool, and so passionate. His funny analogies are usually helpful. Lots of reading but pretty easy. No midterm, and the quiz questions are right out of the in-class questions and reading questions. Easy, enjoyable class: I highly recommend it! Attendance not mandatory. And he's easy on the eyes too!

Ryan is probably the funniest teacher at UCSC. he's super passionate abot astronomy and that translates to his teaching. he's not used to teaching huge lectures but he actually came to my section and helped out with the experiments

He is honestly the funniest professor I've had. He's young, makes HILARIOUS analogies, and makes astronomy really cool. Sometimes he can be a little unclear, or the hw can be confusing, but he's very approachable and more than willing to clarify anything. Oh, if you can't go to class, definitely give your iclicker to a friend.
Really solid guy. The class is not hard, you just have to do a lot of reading. Ryan's good nature infects the whole 200+ person class.
